title: 2  Topology
text:
2.1 What is topology?
Topology is the study of topological spaces. Unfortunately, that doesn’t help too much.
A topological space can be thought of as a set with little “scales” called open sets. Each of these open sets represent the notion of continuity or connectivity that we sense when we look at an object: the feeling that it is just “one single piece of a thing”, like the scales in a fish.

!!!inserir outras imagens?
More formally,

Definition 2.1 A topological space is a pair \((X, \tau)\) where

\(X\) is a set;
\(\tau\) is a set of subsets of \(X\), that is: each \(U \in \tau\) is a set \(U \subseteq X\).

The set \(\tau\) has the following properties:

the intersection of a finite number of open sets is also an open set;
the union of an arbitrary (even infinity) number of open sets is also an open set;
the \(\emptyset\) and \(X\) are open sets.


An example that should be always brought to the mind is the set \(\mathbb{R}\) of real numbers, with open sets given by the open intervals \((a, b) \subseteq \mathbb{R}\) (and its unions).
!!! falar sobre topologia gerada por um subconjunto de \(P(X)\) tomando interseções e uniões.
When an open set \(U\) cannot be written as the disjoint union of two open sets, we say that \(U\) is connected. These connected open sets give a notion of “being a single piece”.
